blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

body:
Dear Phannies:

Just curious. But if you lived in a house that had a balcony, and you lived with other people, how would you refer to said balcony?

It’s not just yours. You live with other people. So “my balcony” isn’t quite right.


I guess you could say “the balcony” that would make sense.


But if you happened to say “our balcony”, which still makes sense, does that mean you’re dating everyone who lives in your house?

reblog.comment:

summary: Phil was trying his best to go to sleep, but he couldn’t, so he had sent me to make him a cup of tea. On the trip back, after...
body:
Phil was trying his best to go to sleep, but he couldn’t, so he had sent me to make him a cup of tea. On the trip back, after delivering the cup, I noticed Quinn in his cot, cooing. “Come to bed” my husband whined. I reassured him that I’d be on my way soon. I crouched next to Quinn and smiled at him. He giggled. “Why aren’t you asleep?” I whispered to my 7 month old. He smiled again. He was a very smiley baby. I ran my hand along his cheek in awe at my beautiful child. “Your entire face fits inside my hand,” I announced to him. Across the room, I heard Phil snoring, he must have drank the tea very quickly.

“Look at your hand! I have fingers bigger than your hand, well, not quite,” I chuckled, and Quinn smiled at me some more. “Tiny hands. Tiny hands.” I thought for a moment before saying, “I wonder what you’ll be when you’re older. Will you be a dancer? Or an actor? Will you follow your dads and join YouTube? Will you be straight? Gay, like papa? Pansexual like me? Something else? Will you remain a tiny man? Or in 17 years will I be talking to my tiny lady? Or my tiny person? I hope you’ll be happy in 17 years, I hope we raise you well Quinny, my tiny man.” The room was silent for a while, Quinn had fallen asleep when I was wondering what his future will be like, I smiled at his sleeping form. “Dan, please come to bed”

“Okay”

“Okay”

I hope you’ll be happy in 17 years, I hope we raise you well Quinny, my tiny man.” The room was silent for a while, Quinn had fallen asleep when I was wondering what his future will be like, I smiled at his sleeping form. “Dan, please come to bed”

“Okay”

I crouched next to Quinn and smiled at him. He giggled. “Why aren’t you asleep?” I whispered to my 7 month old. He smiled again. He was a very smiley baby. I ran my hand along his cheek in awe at my beautiful child. “Your entire face fits inside my hand,” I announced to him. Across the room, I heard Phil snoring, he must have drank the tea very quickly.

“Look at your hand! I have fingers bigger than your hand, well, not quite,” I chuckled, and Quinn smiled at me some more. “Tiny hands. Tiny hands.” I thought for a moment before saying, “I wonder what you’ll be when you’re older. Will you be a dancer? Or an actor? Will you follow your dads and join YouTube? Will you be straight? Gay, like papa? Pansexual like me? Something else? Will you remain a tiny man? Or in 17 years will I be talking to my tiny lady? Or my tiny person? “Okay”
